intro: Ilex hyrcana, commonly known as the Hyrcanian holly, is a species of evergreen shrub or small tree native to the temperate regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Aquifoliaceae and is characterized by its dense, spiny leaves and small, dark berries. The plant typically grows in forested areas and is adapted to a variety of soil types, though it prefers well-drained conditions. Ilex hyrcana is valued for its ornamental qualities and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its aesthetic appeal. Its botanical features make it an important component of the local flora in its native habitat.
